member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Prism.PubSubEvents.EventSubscription`1.GetExecutionStrategy
member.summary: Gets the execution strategy to publish this event.
member.returns: An with the execution strategy, or if the is no longer valid.
member.remarks: If or are no longer valid because they were garbage collected, this method will return . Otherwise it will return a delegate that evaluates the and if it returns will then call . The returned delegate holds hard references to the and target delegates. As long as the returned delegate is not garbage collected, the and references delegates won't get collected either.

member.summary: Subscribes a delegate to an event. PubSubEvent will maintain a to the Target of the supplied delegate.
member.param: The delegate that gets executed when the event is raised.
Specifies on which thread to receive the delegate callback.
member.returns: A that uniquely identifies the added subscription.

member.name: M:Microsoft.Practices.Prism.PubSubEvents.PubSubEvent`1.Subscribe(System.Action{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Subscribes a delegate to an event that will be published on the .
member.param: The delegate that gets executed when the event is published.
When , the keeps a reference to the subscriber so it does not get garbage collected.
member.returns: A that uniquely identifies the added subscription.
member.remarks:
If is set to , will maintain a to the Target of the supplied delegate. If not using a WeakReference ( is ), the user must explicitly call Unsubscribe for the event when disposing the subscriber in order to avoid memory leaks or unexpected behavior.
The PubSubEvent collection is thread-safe.
